Definition: The input contains an argument and a keypoint on the topic "We should legalize cannabis", separated by "<sep>".Your task is to answer if the keypoint matches the argument and summarizes exactly what the argument means, in the contextof this topic.

Positive Examples.input: Argument: It is extremely useful in battling a wide range of medical maladies<sep>Keypoint: If cannabis was legalized it could be regulated
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that it is extremely useful in battling a wide range of medical maladies

Positive Examples.input: Argument: If cannabis is legal it can be regulated and taxed<sep>Keypoint: Alcohol and tobacco are more harmful drugs yet remain legal
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that if cannabis is legal it can be regulated and taxed

Positive Examples.input: Argument: Cannabis is a gateway drug that can lead to users using more potent drugs like cocaine.<sep>Keypoint: Legal cannabis will boost the black-market/criminal activity
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that cannabis is a gateway drug that can lead to users using more potent drugs like cocaine.

Negative Examples.input: Argument: Cannabis should be legalized as it can be beneficial to use cannabis for certain medial conditions.<sep>Keypoint: Cannabis is safe/healthy/pain-relief
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that cannabis should be legalized as it can be beneficial to use cannabis for certain medial conditions.

Negative Examples.input: Argument: Legalizing cannabis opens the door to many more potentially dangerous drugs being legalized, we must make sure that the only legalized use of any drug is controlled by the medical profession.<sep>Keypoint: Cannabis increases lack-of-judgement/accidents

Negative Examples.input: Argument: Cannabis is less dangerous than other things which are currently legal, such as alcohol and cigarettes. it also has many medical uses<sep>Keypoint: If cannabis was legalized it could be regulated
